meanings.definition: The separation of parts of a compound word by one or more intervening words.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the tmesis 'fan-bloody-tastic' shows how words can be split for emphasis.
meanings.sent2: The tmesis 'any-freaking-where' is a common example of breaking up compound words.
meanings.sent3: I always find the tmesis 'abso-bloomin-lutely' quite amusing to say out loud.
meanings.sent4: The tmesis 'un-freaking-believable' creates a powerful impact on the listener.
meanings.sent5: The tmesis 'holy-cow-moly' makes the compound word unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The insertion of one or more words between the parts of a compound word.
meanings.sent1: She used the tmesis 'un-bee-lievable' to emphasize her disbelief.
meanings.sent2: The tmesis 'in-the-middle-of-nowhere' perfectly illustrates this linguistic phenomenon.
meanings.sent3: The tmesis 'a-whole-lot-of-nonsense' added a humorous touch to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: His use of the tmesis 'under-the-radar' was quite clever in the context of the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The tmesis 'over-the-top' vividly demonstrates the concept of inserting words within compound words.
